tier.item: (47) *Òzó suá àkhé ègìégìé/ vbè òwá dé.

21 An N-type adverb can also be understood as modifying both events in a CSVC if and only if it undergoes a shift
in tone to é!gié!gié. (Stewart 1996) takes this to be a sign of a higher attachment site, but all the details have not
`Ozo pushed the pot quickly/in the house down.'
